message_1: What is the result of applying the Higher-order logic function λf.λx.f(f(f(x))) to the constant function λx.3?
message_2:
To apply the higher-order logic function λf.λx.f(f(f(x))) to the constant function λx.3, we need to substitute the constant function for f in the higher-order logic function.

So, we have:

(λf.λx.f(f(f(x)))) (λx.3)

Now, we substitute (λx.3) for f:

λx.(λx.3)((λx.3)((λx.3)(x)))

Now, we apply the constant function (λx.3) to its arguments:

λx.(λx.3)((λx.3)(3))

λx.(λx.3)(3)

λx.3

So, the result of applying the higher-order logic function λf.λx.f(f(f(x))) to the constant function λx.3 is the constant function λx.3.
